definition: to use social connections/to toady to influential people
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: He pulled wires and got us a room at the crowded hotel.
sentences.chinese: 他走门路，给我们在客满的旅馆里弄到了一间空房。

definition: see 走門路|走门路[zou3 men2 lu4]
to seek help from social connections
to seek contact with sb for one's own benefit/to suck up to sb
lit. to enter by the back door/fig. to gain influence by pull or unofficial channels/back door or under the counter connections
to buy a title/to use wealth to acquire office
to pass a message
way of doing sth/the right social connection
to open the back door/fig. under the counter/to do a secret or dishonest deal/to let sth in by the back door
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
lit. to beg grandpa and call on grandma (idiom)/fig. to go about begging for help
pinyin: qiu2 ye2 ye5 gao4 nai3 nai5

definition: to try to form friendly ties with sb for one's own benefit/to suck up to sb
to contribute
lucrative post
(coll.) to gain profit (usu. by underhand means)
to try to gain sb's friendship
